intro: Symplocos glabrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf waxleaf, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its smooth, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers in clusters during the spring, followed by red, fleshy berries in the fall. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained, acidic soils. Symplocos glabrifolia is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
